issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/commit/29352b1a440bd66e940155d05ccc90748b58df8c#diff-ca5e93edaedc922dc00809ef0dc95ec7R189
replace app 'i18n/' and 'platform/' by the same from 'build/' directory without any checks! Are you sure it's good behaviour? I tired to recover it!
fields.summary: Alloy destroy i18n/ and platform/ app directories

comments.body: [~farwayer] Please add your comments to ALOY-858. We'll certainly reconsider the implementation if appropriate. I'm going to close this ticket as a duplicate, though.
